A Message from Jamie Protz, President of the CAHS Class of 2020

“When you face difficult times, know that challenges are not sent to destroy you. They’re sent to promote, increase, and strengthen you." -unknown

Everyone being affected by the COVID-19 pandemic may need motivation, but the senior class especially does. The end of our high school chapter seemed so close, yet with many things to look forward to, like prom and graduation. With intentions to still have these events, we must also continue our education. Online learning is new to all of us, and we are all here to help one another. Let us all embrace this change, and overcome this obstacle healthily and with courage. Finally, be mindful that these circumstances are temporary, and things will get better.

post_text: The Charleroi Middle School has exciting things going on in our science and steam department. STEAM represents the collaboration of science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics. In a partnership with the South Fayette School District, we are part of an initiative from the state called PAsmart, which is a grant to increase steam opportunities within school districts that prepare students for 21st Century professions. Our students will be utilizing coding skills and program design through the use of new technology such as 2 cricut machines, 2 3D laser cutters, and Sphero robots. Students also will have opportunities to compete, in the near future, in the first lego league challenge with their robots!

Raelee Nicholson has been selected as the April girl of the month by the Charthene Club. The announcement was made at the April meeting by Deanna Issi, chairperson of the youth and education committee.

Raelee is an honor roll student and a senior at Charleroi Area High School, where she was inducted into the National Honor Society. She participates in peer tutoring, yearbook club, Foreign Language Club, Westinghouse Girls in Engineering and peer jury as foreman. She was also a guidance office aid and senior interview helper.

Raelee’s community involvement includes counselor at Camp Invention, a freshman transition mentor and a CAHS Career and College Readiness Board member. She helped her grandmother grow vegetables in a garden and shared those vegetables with others in her neighborhood. Raelee is currently working at Cummins as a diesel technician.

She is the daughter of Rob and Beth Nicholson of Charleroi. She plans to continue her education and career in the diesel engine field.

SHASDA Students of the Year

The Charleroi Area School District is seeking applicants for a full time permanent position of Spanish Teacher/English as a Second Language Teacher effective with the 2018-2019 school year. Spanish certified teachers that can obtain an ESL certification by the fall of 2019 will also be considered.

Questions regarding the position are to be addressed to Dr. Zelich, Superintendent, by email at edzelich@charleroisd.org.
